definition: gas/air/smell/weather/to make angry/to annoy/to get angry/vital energy/qi
see 節骨眼|节骨眼[jie1 gu5 yan3]
festival/holiday/node/joint/section/segment/part/to economize/to save/to abridge/moral integrity/classifier for segments, e.g. lessons, train wagons, biblical verses/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: Although immensely ambitious, he would never lose touch with his plebeian roots.
sentences.chinese: 尽管拥有雄心壮志，但他从来没有丢失他的草根气节。

sentences.english: He would rather go hungry than lose his national integrity.
sentences.chinese: 也不卖画宁可挨饿也不丧失气节。

sentences.english: In the fate of the Tianpei, the most we can see that people's integrity.
sentences.chinese: 在命运的颠沛中，最可以看出人们的气节。

sentences.english: The humanistic education of Dong Lin School specially valued integrity.
sentences.chinese: 东林学派的人文教育特别讲究气节。

sentences.english: This tectonic plate highlights the people to the feminine chastity and national moral courage persevering.
sentences.chinese: 此板块凸显出人们对女性贞节和民族气节的坚守。

definition: of noble character and unquestionable integrity (idiom)
one's character/fret (on fingerboard of lute or guitar)
not corrupted by wealth and honors
to give up life for righteousness (idiom, from Mencius); to choose honor over life/would rather sacrifice one's life than one's principles
not to submit to force (idiom); to defy threats and violence
Better broken jade than intact tile./Death is preferable to dishonor. (idiom)
pinyin: ning4 wei2 yu4 sui4 , bu4 wei2 wa3 quan2
